reviews.text: The Idou Anfa is a fairly non-descript, unremarkable hotel in the Casablanca business district. The rooms are small and ordinary, with mine containing two single beds. I wasn't asked if I wanted a double or larger, so I'm not sure they are even available. A colleague of mine and her husband had to push the two beds together in order to sleep in any proximity to each other. My biggest complaint about the bed, notwithstanding the size, was that the mattresses on the beds are extremely hard and uncomfortable. I felt I would have gotten a better sleep on a hard park bench.
reviews.title: Difficulty Sleeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bath room was sparse, with the toilet actually in another small room (very odd, I thought). The worst feature, though, was the narrow tub that meant every time I showered, the nasty looking shower curtain would blow inward, sticking to me while I tried to get clean.
reviews.title: Better than we expected

reviews.text: The restaurant was pretty poor, and the breakfast buffet offered limited choices and low quality breads and croissants. We deliberately avoided the hotel restaurant when we could make other arrangements.
reviews.title: Perfectly good hotel - nothing special but nothing bad either.
BURGLED LAST NIGHT OF STAY
reviews.text: I can't really say much positive about the Idou, except my experience with the staff was really okay. They at least helped quickly with the bags, although a tip was always expected.

The reviews for this hotel were average but as our tour was starting from here we decided to book in anyway. We were pleasantly surprised and maybe that's because it was renovated in November 2010. The room was a reasonable size, bathroom clean and separate toilet. Flatscreen tv and free wi-fi in the room. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Staff were helpful and it's walking distance to the mosque and medina.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: We had to stay here through a group booking, otherwise having read the previous reviews would have avoided this place. Unfriendly, impersonal and very, very noisy in a streetfront room. The view of the Mosque was the only redeeming feature. Within a couple of minutes of checking in, we had a visit from the Security Manager accusing us of having a fire in our room, which was in fact our water boiler! He made us unplug this, so we did so and then plugged it back in when he left. The previous 3 nights we had stayed at the Hotel Maamoura, which was a 3rd of the price and brilliant, and in a more central location. Everything previous reviewers have said about the staff is very true. The breakfast was very good, but we would rather have had a peaceful nights sleep! If you have to stay here ask for a room out the back. We're also capable of carrying our own packs up to our room, and didn't like being hassled by the porter who no doubt was annoyed at not getting a tip, and showed it.
reviews.title: Disappointed like everyone else

likes.liked: — view of the Mosque from rooms at the front

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights upon our arrival to Morocco. We had chosen this hotel because it was the hotel used by our organized tour in Morocco.
reviews.title: Not great value, but a nice view from the top

likes.liked: — The view from the bar on the top floor.
likes.disliked: — The general condition of the rooms and the separated bathroom and toilets.

reviews.text: The building itself looks quite modern, and the public areas like the lobby, the breakfast area, the pool, and the bar on the top are very well maintained.
reviews.title: Nothing Changes...

reviews.text: However, the rooms did not meet the same standards. Our room on the sixth floor was relatively clean, reasonably sized, and the shower had great water pressure. However, the room was very worn and was wholly unremarkable. There was also a working room safe, in room air conditioning, and television.
reviews.title: Of all the hotels in all the world, this has to be one of the worst...

likes.disliked: — The general lack of humanity of the staff.

reviews.title: Good location... that's about it
reviews.text: With regards to the other hotel amenities, the breakfast at the hotel was above average, with a variety of Moroccan and western alternatives. As well, the bar on the top floor of the hotel had a spectacular view of Casablanca, and there was live music in the evening. However, the pool was hard to access, one had to walk through a meeting room to get to it, even though the meeting room was some times in use.

I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of my one week tour around Morocco. It has been my dream to travel to Morocco for a long time so arriving at Casablanca, I was rather excited. Unfortunately the hotel was not the best way to start the trip. The hotel itself is of a very low quality, the rooms are very shabby and old, it needs renovation. The airconditioning was only set on low and we had to chance our room to move up a few floors (where apparently the renovated rooms are) to be able to get the room with enough AC to feel comfortable in the 40 degree heat. The bar on the top floor was a highlight. There is entertainment there every night and we didn't see any tourists there, but only the locals. It was fun to sit and observe everyone and listen to a very talented singer. The location of the hotel is also not the best. On one occasion, when we tried to get a taxi it took us over 30 minutes to wait for one.There is nothing within walking distance. The hotel staff were very friendly though and tried their best to make our stay memorable. Overall, I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: The reviews had me very concerned as my company booked this hotel for a conference. I was pleasantly surprised- room was large with two chairs, WC, separate bathroom, and sliders to a false balcony. The bed was extremely comfortable. Internet access was free- supposed to use the wired version, but did not work in my room and the Wifi that was not supposed to work in the room absolutely did! Breakfast was lovely, and we had lunch at the hotel as well and it was very nice.
reviews.title: Not anywhere near the badness I expected

reviews.text: I did not have any trouble with theft, people randomly coming into my room, etc- none of my colleagues did either. Also, there was an in-room safe large enough for my laptop, ipod, etc, and I made use of that.
reviews.title: Good Casablanca Hotel
ok
reviews.text: Saw the pool but did not have time to swim! Hotel is on a busy, seemingly main street, but did not seem to be too much nearby, except a KFC.

Some folks have commented on an odd smell in the rooms- I noticed it as well, first in the hotel, and then in other buildings. For those of us who do not live in a place with AC running 24/7, it is an odd smell, but all I could chalk it up to was non-stop AC everywhere!

Idou Anfa - Casablana
reviews.text: Nice clean hotel. Good staff. And very nice food in the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After changing rooms several times during our four day stay, we never succeeded in finding a clean restroom. Eventually we gave in and walked to a nearby store to buy supplies to disinfect and deodorize the toilet area. The staff touched breakfast items directly with their hands when they thought guests were not looking, and the taste reflected the lack of care and attention. We tipped the cleaning ladies only to find that they finished ’cleaning’ the room in three minutes when we happened to return to get something from our belongings. The uniforms the staff wore appeared to have been washed so many times that there were only bare tissue thin fibers left, exemplifying the cheapskate management priorities end to end. Lastly at night, an ugly night scene developed with the smell of alcohol in public ares, low class people at a piano bar, and people you would not want to appear in the same picture with in the newspaper the next morning ... Apparently this is one of the more famous higher end hotels in Casablanca with prices around $200 per night. Their free policies at night is the only reason I can think of as why somebody would pay this kind of money for trash like this. The hotel, staff, and lobby loiterers are all of this same low level of class ...
reviews.title: Poor Cleanliness Standards
A good experience
reviews.text: Coming to Casablanca with experienced guys I am happy to recommend this hotel for its nice rooms, good service and OK situation.

reviews.title: Got robbed and hotel says "it is your problem"
reviews.text: I left my room to have dinner at the hotel's restaurant. When I got back to my room, after being away for about 1 hour, my Iphone was missing and also 100 dolar from my wallet. I asked the staff for help, and not only they didn't help at all, but also treated me in a very offensive way. Despite they had the entry log to my room showing that someone entered it at 21:45 (I was away from 21:00 'till 22:15), they insisted that there was nothing wrong and I was lying. The chief of security even said to me that it was my problem and he didn't care, because it was not his money.
Rooms with view on the Mosquée are nice but very noisy ( on the street ) even from 14th floor. Ask a room behind ( view on the twn towers ).
reviews.title: Bad experience at Idou Anfa
